page.title: 16SERVICES IN LANDRAKE
page.content: Many essential services have to be brought to the village.All homes have electricity which was not true in the 1950's.As the village is cut in two by the A38 road,when there is a power failure it does not last long because the lighting on the main road has to be quickly switched back on. There is no gas supplied,though the actual gas main runs less than a mile away.Heating therefore for homes is electricity,solid fuel,oil or Calor gas.Both the last two must be brought in by tanker,usually from Plymouth. Deliveries of solid fuel are made on a regular basis during winter months by two coal merchants from Saltash and one from Looe. Landrake telephone numbers have still only 3 figures,but there are plans to build a new telephone exchange nearby which may change to 6 figures.
